questions.question: When oncoming traffic prevents you from making an immediate left turn, you should:
choices: Slow down and stop if necessary
Alert oncoming traffic by using horn or headlights
Start turning, oncoming traffic will always stop

questions.question: During a traffic stop by law enforcement, you should:
choices: Remain in your vehicle and wait for the officer to approach
Keep your hands on the wheel
Roll down your window
All answers are correct

questions.question: Check tire air pressure with an air pressure gauge when:
choices: You have been driving for 30 minutes
You have been driving for at least one hour
Tires are cold

questions.question: What is true about pavement markings on a four-lane divided highway?
choices: White lane lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the opposite direction
White lane lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction
Yellow lane lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction

questions.question: When an emergency vehicle using flashing lights approaches from the other direction, you must
choices: Drive as close as possible to the right edge of the road
Pull over to the right edge of the roadway and stop
Stay in your lane and slow down

questions.question: Who must yield at a roundabout?
choices: Exiting traffic
Incoming traffic
Circulating traffic

questions.question: What traffic must stop if a school bus with flashing red lights stops in the far-right lane on a four-lane street without a barrier between lanes?
choices: All lanes of traffic
Lanes going in the same direction as the bus
Lanes going in the opposite direction of the bus

questions.question: An arrow panel displaying this message means:
choices: Sharp Curve
Merge to the right
Detour

questions.question: You should always pass a tractor-trailer:
choices: Quickly and always on the right side
Completely and always on the left side
Slowly and on either side

questions.question: A good defensive driver should:
choices: Anticipate potential problems
Drive slowly at all times
Only drive in familiar areas
All answers are correct

questions.question: If your wheels drift off the pavement onto the shoulder, it can be hazardous to:
choices: Quickly swerve back onto the pavement without slowing down
Use your brakes carefully
Take your foot off the gas pedal

questions.question: If you drive slower than the flow of traffic on a multi-lane highway, you should:
choices: Use the extreme left lane
Use the middle lane
Use the extreme right lane

questions.question: When a traffic signal is showing a flashing red light, you must:
choices: Stop and remain stopped until a green signal appears
Stop completely, only proceed when you can do so safely
Slow down and be especially alert

questions.question: What is true about braking if you suddenly have a tire blowout while driving?
choices: Pump the brakes
Apply the brakes firmly
Stay off the brakes

questions.question: Why should you check over your shoulder after passing a bicyclist and returning to your position?
choices: To check distance to roadside
To make sure your mirrors are adjusted
To make sure your blind spot is clear

questions.question: You should use extra caution when approaching a pedestrian using a white cane because the pedestrian:
choices: Has impaired hearing
Has a walking problem
Is visually impaired

questions.question: The best way to reduce the chance of injury or death in a crash is to:
choices: Always keep a following distance of two seconds
Always drive slower than the flow of traffic
Wear seat belts

questions.question: In Indiana, it is a criminal offense to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) above the legal limit. The legal limit is:
choices: 0.12 percent
0.02 percent
0.08 percent

questions.question: When driving on a slippery surface, you should:
choices: Use cruise control to keep constant speed
Follow other vehicles closely to get better traction
Start braking early when you come to a stop

questions.question: Why should you avoid leaving vents open when following closely behind another car?
choices: There is a risk of carbon monoxide poisoning
Open vents are a driver distraction
It is illegal

questions.question: If you pull off the road and stop on the shoulder because of heavy fog, you should:
choices: Keep your flashing emergency signals turned on
Abandon your car as soon as possible
Turn off all lights

questions.question: If you are involved in an accident, other drivers involved in the accident have the right to:
choices: See your driver's license
See your vehicle registration card
Get your name and address
All answers are correct

questions.question: When passing and overtaking horses or horse-drawn vehicles:
choices: Speed up to pass as quickly as possible
Sound your horn and keep a distance of three feet
Use caution and be alert

questions.question: What is true about merging onto an interstate highway?
choices: You must drive faster than the highway traffic to find a safe gap
Before merging, you should drive to the end of the acceleration lane and stop
Yield to the traffic already on the highway

questions.question: An unbroken yellow line on the right-hand side of the centerline means:
choices: A restricted lane
A no passing zone
You may pass, if it is safe to do so

questions.question: Driving while suspended will result in the following points on your driving record:
choices: Eight points
Six points
Four points

questions.question: You should always signal before you:
choices: Change lanes
Pull away from the curb
Exit a freeway
All answers are correct

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, you may exceed the speed limit:
choices: If you cannot complete the pass before a no passing zone
With 10 mph on roads where speed limit is 45 mph or higher
In no situation

questions.question: Which factor can significantly affect your vehicle's ability to stop quickly?
choices: Posted speed limit
Use of safety belts and airbags
Wet roadway surfaces

questions.question: At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if:
choices: You make a complete stop first
You are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear
You wait until the light changes

questions.question: If red lights are flashing and gates are closing at a railroad crossing, you must:
choices: Stop and wait until the gates close, then drive carefully around the gates
Stop and remain stopped until gates open and lights stop flashing
Speed up and pass the crossing before the gates close

questions.question: At a fire hydrant, the law prohibits parking:
choices: Within 30 feet
Within 15 feet
Within 20 feet

questions.question: When backing a vehicle, you should back slowly because:
choices: The legal speed limit while backing is 10 mph
It is more difficult to control your speed and direction while backing
You must rely on your mirrors while backing

questions.question: Light gray areas in this picture indicate:
choices: Free zone
Blind spots
Safety maneuver spot

questions.question: You are turning onto a two-lane road divided by a broken yellow line. You know immediately that:
choices: You are on a one-way road
You are on a two-way road
That you are entering a work zone

questions.question: Why should you avoid making sudden lane changes or stops in front of a tractor-trailer?
choices: A tractor-trailer is more maneuverable than a car
A tractor-trailer swings wide before stopping
A tractor-trailer will take longer to stop

questions.question: When an emergency vehicle using flashing lights approaches from behind, you must
choices: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down
Pull over to the right edge of the roadway and stop
Proceed at normal speed, the emergency vehicle will move over to pass

questions.question: When driving in fog, the road and objects ahead are better illuminated by:
choices: Low headlight beams
High headlight beams
Vehicle's interior lights

questions.question: What is true about sharrow markings (sharrows)?
choices: They mark lanes reserved for bicyclists
They mark lanes reserved for bicyclists and motorcyclists
They mark lanes shared by bicyclists and motorists

questions.question: During a traffic stop by a police officer, you may cause unnecessary anxiety for the officer if you:
choices: Keep all vehicle doors closed
Dig in the glove compartment or under the seat
Keep your hands on the steering wheel

questions.question: When driving in a roundabout, drivers should:
choices: Not change lanes inside the roundabout
Stop and signal before exiting
Always exit in the right-hand lane

questions.question: What is true about Anti-Lock Brakes (ABS)?
choices: ABS helps you maintain steering ability while braking
ABS requires constant pumping of the brake pedal
ABS reduces your stopping distance
All answers are correct

questions.question: Why is it dangerous to start your vehicle or warm up the engine in a closed garage?
choices: It is against the law
Your engine is likely to stall
Because of carbon monoxide

questions.question: If your vehicle does not have antilock brakes and the brakes suddenly fail to respond, you should:
choices: Continue driving at slow speed until you reach a garage
Pump the brake pedal several times to build up pressure
Flash your headlights to warn others

questions.question: Passenger restrictions are placed on a probationary license for the first:
choices: Year
180 days
90 days

questions.question: Parking is prohibited:
choices: 20 feet from a fire hydrant
In front of a private driveway
On a hill

questions.question: Before turning left, it is essential to:
choices: Swing to the right side of your lane
Move into the proper lane well before the turn
Sound your horn

questions.question: If you are involved in a collision, you must:
choices: Stop at the scene
Get help if someone is injured
Exchange information with other drivers
All answers are correct

questions.question: Why should you avoid U-turns whenever possible?
choices: They require you to concentrate on your driving
They are illegal in Indiana
They are potentially dangerous

questions.question: When a doctor prescribes drugs, which are likely to affect your driving, you should:
choices: Not drive
Avoid driving on interstate highways
Drive at 30 mph or slower

questions.question: The risk of hydroplaning increases:
choices: With reduced visibility
With decreased following distance
With increased speed

questions.question: When driving in winter weather, you should:
choices: Always drive with your parking lights turned on
Speed up when you approach bridges and overpasses
Drive with a full tank of gas

questions.question: A traffic light with a green arrow indicates that:
choices: Oncoming traffic is stopped by a red light
You can make a safe turn without checking other traffic
All other vehicles and pedestrians have a red light
None of the above answers are correct

questions.question: If a school bus is picking up or dropping off children on the other side of a four-lane road with a raised barrier separation, you should:
choices: Proceed with caution
Always stop
Stop only when the bus has stopped in a loading zone

questions.question: True or false? Hand signals indicate an emergency and always give you the right to make the indicted maneuver.
choices: True
False

questions.question: When can you cross the center divider of an interstate highway?
choices: In no situation
If no cross-over has been established
If the median is wide enough for your vehicle

questions.question: When passing a bicycle traveling in the same direction, drivers are required to allow a safe space of:
choices: At least six feet
At least three feet
No more than two feet

questions.question: What should you do if you must make a conscious effort to keep your eyes open while driving?
choices: Stop and rest, or let another person drive
Stave it off with loud music
Open a window for fresh air

questions.question: As a driver, you do not need to wear seat belts:
choices: When driving 20 mph or slower
When driving on public roads
When the car is equipped with airbags
None of the above answers are correct

questions.question: When following a large truck that blocks your view ahead, you should:
choices: Drive up as closely as possible
Slow down and fall back
Turn on your headlights

questions.question: What does this pattern on an arrow board mean?
choices: That you should drive with caution
That the road ahead is closed
That the lane ahead is closed (change lane)

questions.question: When approaching an intersection where the traffic light changes from green to yellow, you should:
choices: Speed up and enter the intersection before the red light comes on
Stop, unless you are too close to the intersection to stop safely
Keep speed and continue through the intersection

questions.question: What can help to reduce glare from oncoming vehicles at night?
choices: Adjusting your instrument lights and make them brighter
Turning on your high-beam headlights
Focusing on the right side of the road, away from the glare

questions.question: You are passing a car when you see this sign. You should:
choices: Drop back and pass after the intersection, if is safe
Stay beside the car until passing the intersection
Speed up and finish passing before you reach the intersection

questions.question: Which is always a safe speed on two-lane highways?
choices: 60 mph
55 mph
70 mph
None of the above answers are correct

questions.question: If you cannot get in the clear on the other side of a railroad crossing, you should:
choices: Stop on the tracks if no train is approaching
Cross the tracks on the left side of the road
Stop before the tracks

questions.question: If you see a pedestrian with a white cane at a crosswalk, you should:
choices: Stop and give the pedestrian the right-of-way at all times
Stop and turn off your engine, so it is clear that you have stopped
Honk your horn

questions.question: You are driving in the left lane of a high-speed roadway with several lanes. You want to exit ahead. What should you do?
choices: Change lanes one at a time until you are in the proper lane
Use emergency flashers and drive across all lanes
Slow down or stop until you can drive across all lanes safely

questions.question: What is the best way to keep traction and avoid hydroplaning on wet roads?
choices: Adjust speed and drive slowly
Keep speed and go straight
Keep your tires overinflated

questions.question: Why should you always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes?
choices: The motorcycle's smaller size makes them harder to see
It is illegal for motorcycles to share traffic lanes
Motorcyclists always have the right-of-way

questions.question: If you hit an unattended vehicle and are unable to find the owner, you must:
choices: Contact a law enforcement officer or agency
Return to the scene later
Immediately notify your insurance company

questions.question: You are driving on a freeway posted for 65 mph. Around you, traffic is traveling at 70 mph. What should your speed be?
choices: Faster than 70 mph
No faster than 65 mph
70 mph to keep up with traffic

questions.question: True or false? Your blind spot is the area directly in front of your vehicle.
choices: False
True

questions.question: You want to pass another vehicle on a two-lane road. There is a curve ahead that blocks your view. What should you do?
choices: Not pass the other vehicle
Use your horn to encourage the other driver to let you pass
Increase your speed to pass safely

questions.question: An arrow panel displaying this message means:
choices: Merge to the left
Sharp Curve
Detour

questions.question: A center lane with yellow pavement markings on both sides is:
choices: A reversible lane
A shared center lane for left turns
A carpool lane

questions.question: After a train has passed a railroad crossing with more than one track, you should:
choices: Wait and make sure another train is not coming
Pass the first track and stop before crossing the second
Move forward as soon as the train passes

questions.question: It is illegal to use a handheld cell phone for text messaging while driving:
choices: False
True

questions.question: When two vehicles from different directions arrive at the same time at a four-way stop, which one must yield?
choices: The vehicle that is bigger
The vehicle that is traveling faster
The vehicle approaching from the left

questions.question: If you refuse to take a chemical test to measure how much alcohol is in your system:
choices: You are subject to an insurance surcharge of $500
It is punishable by 72 hours to 180 days in jail
Your driver's license may be suspended for up to two years

questions.question: Always turn your front wheels away from the curb when you are parked on a grade and facing:
choices: Downhill only
Both uphill and downhill
Uphill only

questions.question: Signaling your intentions before turning or changing lanes:
choices: Is not necessary at slow speeds
Is necessary only if other traffic is present
Is required by law

questions.question: On a divided roadway separated by a physical barrier, you must stop for a stopped school bus with an extended stop arm, regardless of your direction of travel.
choices: False
True

questions.question: What does a traffic signal with a flashing yellow light mean?
choices: Stop completely and yield
Slow down and proceed with caution
The red signal is about to appear

questions.question: On a road with yellow center lines:
choices: Traffic flows in one direction only
Traffic flows in two (opposite) directions
Crossing the yellow lines is prohibited

questions.question: On cold, wet days, which of the following roadways is most likely to hide spots of ice?
choices: Roadways on bridges and overpasses
Roadways paved with asphalt
Roadways on hilltops

questions.question: A large tractor-trailer turns right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The tractor-trailer:
choices: May need to swing wide to complete the turn
Will always complete its turn in the left lane to eliminate a wide turn
Must always stay in the right lane when turning

questions.question: When driving in winter weather, why should you drive with a full gas tank?
choices: It keeps the gas from freezing
If stranded, the heater can remain in use for as long as possible
It improves your vehicle's stability and tire traction

questions.question: To turn left from a one-way street onto a one-way street, start from:
choices: The lane closest to the left curb
Any lane as soon as it seems safe to do so
The center lane

questions.question: During foggy weather, a driver should turn on the vehicle's high-beam headlights to increase the field of vision.
choices: False
True

questions.question: The most effective thing you can do to reduce your risk of getting injured or killed in a traffic crash is:
choices: Stay in the right lane on multi-lane highways
Drive 10 mph slower than the posted speed limit
Wear your seat belt

questions.question: You observe an oncoming vehicle in your traffic lane. You should:
choices: Brake hard to a complete stop in your traffic lane
Not enter the oncoming traffic lane
Honk your horn and steer to the left into the oncoming traffic lane

questions.question: To back your vehicle safely:
choices: Tap your horn and look through the rear-view mirror
Do not depend on your mirrors
Back quickly and use side mirrors to guide you

questions.question: When you approach a bicyclist using a roundabout, you should:
choices: Stay behind
Pass on the left
Pass on the right

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
choices: Stop
Merge right
Merge left

questions.question: Which traffic light has the same meaning as a stop sign?
choices: Flashing red
Steady red
Flashing yellow

questions.question: If you are involved in a collision, you must always:
choices: Stop at the scene
Immediately move injured people out of the traffic lane
File an accident report with the BMV
All answers are correct

questions.question: A motorist who fails a chemical test may have their driving privileges suspended for up to:
choices: 30 days
60 days
180 days

questions.question: You should never attempt to overtake a bicyclist:
choices: Just before making a right turn
On a one-way street
On a divided highway

questions.question: When driving on a two-lane road and approaching within 100 feet of a railroad crossing:
choices: You must turn on your headlights
You must slow down to 15 mph or less
You must not pass another vehicle

questions.question: If your vehicle has anti-lock brakes and you hear a rumble from the brakes and the brake pedal vibrates while braking, you must:
choices: Remove your foot from the brake pedal
Keep steady pressure on the brake pedal
Start pumping the brake pedal

questions.question: A solid white line between lanes means:
choices: Traffic flows in opposite directions
You should not change lanes
All traffic must exit ahead

questions.question: When a traffic signal turns green, you:
choices: May need to stop to avoid blocking the intersection
Should not drive faster than 15 mph
Always have the right-of-way
All answers are correct

questions.question: You should always use extra caution when driving at night because:
choices: There is a larger volume of traffic
Traffic is faster
Things are more difficult to identify and recognize at night

questions.question: Before turning left at an intersection, it is essential to:
choices: Sound your horn
Yield to oncoming vehicles
Move to the right side of your lane

questions.question: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
choices: Passing is allowed if the broken line is on your side
Passing is not allowed in either direction
Passing on the left is permitted in either direction

questions.question: You may park in a fire lane:
choices: Under no circumstances
If you park for 30 minutes or less
If no other parking spaces are available

questions.question: When a pedestrian crosses at an uncontrolled intersection, you should:
choices: Give the pedestrian the right-of-way
Make the pedestrian aware that you are approaching
Change lane so you do not have to slow down
None of the above answers are correct

questions.question: You are following a school bus, and there is a railroad crossing ahead. You must slow down and prepare to stop because the bus:
choices: Must stop at the crossing
Will drive slower when driving across tracks
Needs more space when driving across tracks

questions.question: When is it legal for a person under 21 years of age to use a cell phone while driving?
choices: When making a 911 emergency call
Whenever it seems safe to do so
When stopped at a red light

questions.question: You are about to make a left turn on a rod where the speed limit is 50 mph. Before turning, you must signal continuously for at least:
choices: 200 feet
300 feet
100 feet

questions.question: Driving at the posted speed limit:
choices: May be dangerous and illegal, if roads are slick or icy
Is never illegal, if you are over 21 years of age
Is always safe, if you keep to the left on a multi-lane highway

questions.question: A school bus has stopped to pick up or drop off children. The bus has stopped on your side of an undivided highway with two lanes. You must:
choices: Pass as quickly as possible
Slow down and proceed with caution
Always stop

questions.question: To check your blind spot when changing lanes to the left, you should:
choices: Turn your head toward the left lane
Rely on your left side mirror
Constantly look in your rear-view mirror

questions.question: It is always illegal to use a cell phone while driving:
choices: True
False

questions.question: An Indiana driver's license is considered probationary until a driver is:
choices: 18 years
16 years
21 years

questions.question: If you are in a roundabout when an emergency vehicle with flashing lights approaches from behind, you should:
choices: Proceed through the roundabout before stopping
Continue through the roundabout as slow as possible, then stop
Move to the right in the roundabout and stop

questions.question: Always signal to other drivers when you:
choices: Plan to turn left
Plan to turn right
Plan to stop
All answers are correct

questions.question: You are approaching a work zone on an interstate. What should you do?
choices: Stay close to any vehicle in front of you
Speed up to clear the work zone quickly
Stay alert and obey all speed limits

questions.question: Which is a primary factor affecting your blood alcohol concentration (BAC)?
choices: How quickly alcohol is consumed
How physically fit you are
The kind of food you eat with your drink

questions.question: When a law enforcement officer's command is different from a traffic sign or signal, you should:
choices: Follow your own judgment
Obey the traffic sign or signal
Obey the officer

questions.question: You can cross over broken white lines:
choices: When it is safe to change lanes
At any time
Only during daylight hours

questions.question: When driving on a rural interstate highway, and unless otherwise posted, you may not drive faster than:
choices: 70 mph
55 mph
60 mph

questions.question: To help others see you when daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
choices: Interior lights
Low beam headlights
Parking lights

questions.question: When driving on a two-lane road and approaching within 100 feet of an intersection, you must:
choices: Turn on your headlights
Slow down to 15 mph or less
Not pass another vehicle

questions.question: When entering an interstate highway:
choices: You must yield to vehicles already on the highway
Pull into traffic even if the way is not clear
Vehicles on the highway must yield by changing lanes

questions.question: When making a left turn on a two-way street with multiple lanes, you should:
choices: Complete the turn in the closest lane going in your direction
Complete the turn in either lane going in your direction
Complete the turn in the right-hand lane of the cross street

questions.question: If your vehicle plunges into water:
choices: Exit the vehicle through the rear door and swim for shore
Remain calm and keep safety belt on
Do not attempt to open a door

questions.question: You are on a two-lane roadway with a center left-turn lane. If a school bus stops on the other side of the road and activates flashing red lights, you must:
choices: Slow down and pass carefully
Always stop
Stop only if children are crossing the street

questions.question: While crossing railroad tracks, you should:
choices: Avoid stopping or shifting gears
Stop on tracks to make sure they are clear
Turn on emergency flashers

questions.question: What can you check by using Lincoln's head on a penny?
choices: Tire tread
Window tinting
Wiper blades

questions.question: Up to which age must children be properly secured in a child restraint system?
choices: Eight years
10 years
12 years

questions.question: On a country road at night, a vehicle with high beams comes toward you. What should you do?
choices: Drive as closely as possible to the center of the road
Look down toward the left edge of your lane
Slow down and look down at the right edge of the road

questions.question: You can park and leave your car:
choices: 25 feet from a fire hydrant
On a crosswalk
On a sidewalk that is not used
None of the above answers are correct

questions.question: You may cross a double solid yellow line:
choices: At any time, if it is safe to do so
In no situation
When making a safe left turn

questions.question: You have a green light at an intersection. A funeral procession is crossing your path. What should you do?
choices: Honk your horn and insist on the right-of-way
Yield the right-of way and stay where you are
Proceed slowly and look for a gap between the vehicles in the procession
